item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue subscribed over 130 times so far; check GMP. Apply or not? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue subscribed over 130 times so far; check GMP. Apply or not?

Date: 02 Jan, 2025

Source: HT Digital Streams Limited

The Indo Farm Equipment IPO is witnessing strong demand and has been heavily oversubscribed as it enters its final day of bidding. Investors have only one day left to apply.

  • Price band set at ₹204 to ₹215 per share, aiming to raise ₹260.15 crore.
  • IPO subscribed over 130 times with various segments showing significant interest.
  • Indsec Securities recommends a 'Subscribe' rating for the IPO.
  • The company plans to use the IPO funds for capacity expansion and repayment of borrowings.
“Given industry tailwinds and superior financial metrics, we assign a SUBSCRIBE rating to the IPO.”

This IPO is a significant opportunity for investors looking for growth in the agricultural sector.

item.title: Bajaj Finance shares jump over 5% as Citi maintains 'Buy' on Q3 optimism, sees up to 17% upside for stock - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Bajaj Finance shares jump over 5% as Citi maintains 'Buy' on Q3 optimism, sees up to 17% upside for stock

Date: January 02, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Bajaj Finance share price surged over 5 percent in Thursday's trade after analysts at the brokerage Citi reiterated its 'Buy' rating on the stock. The stock climbed to an intraday high of Rs 7,306.05, marking a 5.34 percent gain from its previous close.

  • Citi has set a price target of Rs 8,150 for Bajaj Finance, indicating a potential upside of 17.51 percent from Wednesday's closing price.
  • The brokerage highlighted expectations of loan growth stability and a positive bias in net interest margins.
  • Key support is coming from segments like mortgage financing and sales financing.
  • A marginal rise in credit costs is estimated between 2.2 to 2.5 percent.
"Key support is coming from segments like mortgage financing, sales financing, and new business ventures," Citi noted in its report.

This positive movement in Bajaj Finance shares aligns with the overall rise in the finance and NBFC sector.

item.title: Hyundai India announces CRETA Electric, to be offered in four variants; shares rise 2% - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Hyundai India announces CRETA Electric, to be offered in four variants; shares rise 2%

Date: January 02, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Hyundai Motor India unveiled the Hyundai CRETA Electric on January 2, leading to a 2% rise in the company's shares.

  • The CRETA Electric will be offered in four variants with two battery pack options: 51.4kWh (Long Range) and 42kWh.
  • The driving ranges are 473 km and 390 km for the respective battery packs.
  • Hyundai aims to redefine the EV market in India with this model, focused on design, technology, and safety.
  • The company's shares surged to Rs 1,854 apiece on its announcement.
“This groundbreaking electric SUV combines bold design, cutting-edge technology, and unparalleled safety to set new benchmarks in India’s EV market.” – Hyundai

The launch of the Hyundai CRETA Electric marks a significant step in the company's electric vehicle strategy, aiming to inspire confidence in electric vehicles among Indian consumers.

item.title: Hyundai Creta Electric Unveiled; Check Range, Features, And More - NDTV
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Stock market today: Sensex surges 1,300 points, Nifty tops 24,000. What's behind the rally? Explained with 5 reasons | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indian Stock Market Rallies: Sensex Gains 1,300 Points, Nifty Surpasses 24,000

Publication Date: Thursday

Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market saw a significant upward movement on Thursday, with the Sensex soaring over 1,300 points and the Nifty 50 crossing the 24,000 mark, driven by strong buying in banking and IT stocks.

Key Points:

  • The Sensex reached an intraday peak of 79,542.69.
  • The Nifty 50 index rose by 328.45 points to settle at 24,071.35.
  • Positive sentiment was driven by increased optimism for upcoming quarterly earnings.
  • Key contributors to the surge included banking and IT sectors.
  • Global market trends and improved GST collection contributed to investor confidence.
“Domestic benchmark index Nifty opened flat on the first trading session of the new calendar year... settled the day on a positive note at 23,743.” - Hrishikesh Yedve, AVP Technical and Derivatives Research

This rally in the stock market showcases resilience and optimism among investors, reflecting positive trends across various sectors.

item.title: Jai Corp Shares Tumble 20% On Selling Land Parcel To Reliance Industries - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Jai Corp Shares Drop 20% Following Land Sale to Reliance Industries

Date: 02 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit

Shares of Jai Corp experienced a significant decline of nearly 20% after the company sold a large industrial land parcel to Reliance Industries Ltd.

  • Jai Corp's stock fell to Rs 248.4 per share on the NSE.
  • The unit, Urban Infrastructure Holdings Pvt. Ltd., sold its 74% stake in Navi Mumbai IIA for Rs 1,628.03 crore.
  • This transaction values the entire company at Rs 2,200 crore.
  • Reliance Industries stated that the investment was not a related party transaction.
  • Navi Mumbai IIA became a subsidiary of Reliance following the acquisition.
“The appreciation potential of the land parcel exceeds the acquisition cost.”

The sale reflects significant shifts in the industrial land market and has created notable reactions among investors.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue subscribed over 100 times so far; check GMP. Apply or not? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates

Date: January 2, 2025 Source: Live Updates

Introduction

The Indo Farm Equipment IPO has entered its final day of bidding, with high demand as it has been oversubscribed. Investors are urged to apply before the deadline.

Key Points

  • The IPO is subscribed over 100 times, with a total of 85 million shares traded compared to 840,000 shares on offer.
  • Price band set at ₹204 to ₹215, aiming to raise ₹260.15 crore.
  • Approximately 52.16% of revenue comes from tractors; risk factors include demand fluctuations.
  • Valuation appears expensive at a P/E ratio of 51.81 compared to the industry average.
  • Industry outlook shows significant growth in the tractor and crane markets over the coming years.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

“Indo Farm Equipment IPO was subscribed 100.42 times so far.”

Conclusion

Given the strong oversubscription rate and growth potential, the Indo Farm Equipment IPO presents a compelling opportunity for long-term investors, particularly those open to higher risks.

item.title: Vroom! Eicher Motors shares zoom to a record high after strong Royal Enfield sales in December - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Eicher Motors Shares Surge 8% Following Strong December Sales for Royal Enfield

Date: Jan 2, 2025 Source: CNBC-TV18

Eicher Motors Ltd. saw its shares increase by 8% after reporting strong sales for its Royal Enfield motorcycles in December. Royal Enfield's total sales for the month grew by 25% compared to last year.

  • Royal Enfield sold 79,466 units in December 2024, up from 63,887 units in December 2023.
  • Models under 350 cc had sales of 69,476 units, also a 25% increase.
  • Exports nearly doubled to 11,575 units compared to last year.
  • Eicher's share price reached a record high of ₹5,288.2.
“As we gear up for 2025, we are looking forward to sustaining our growth momentum...” - B Govindarajan, CEO of Royal Enfield

The company is expanding its operations globally, with the establishment of a CKD assembly facility in Bangkok and expanding its pre-owned motorcycle business to 236 cities in India.

item.title: CreditAccess Grameen, Spandana Sphoorty shares gain up to 9% on this MFIN decision - CNBCTV18
item.description:
CreditAccess Grameen, Spandana Sphoorty shares gain up to 9% on this MFIN decision

Date: January 2, 2025 Source: CNBC-TV18

On January 2, 2025, stocks in the microfinance segment, such as CreditAccess Grameen and Spandana Sphoorty, saw gains of up to 9% after the MicroFinance Institute Network (MFIN) announced a three-month delay in the implementation of new lending caps.

  • Microfinance stocks gained after MFIN's announcement.
  • The MFIN delay allows more time for lenders managing their stress and delinquencies.
  • New lending caps will now be implemented by April 1, 2025.
  • Industries related to microfinance were under stress, with overdues on the rise.
  • Shares of CreditAccess Grameen rose 9.3% to ₹973.55, while Spandana Sphoorty increased by 2.5% to ₹337.3.
“Microfinance overdues are up 110 basis points on a month-on-month basis in November 2024,” - UBS report.

In conclusion, the MFIN's decision to delay the caps offers relief to microfinance companies amidst rising defaults and stress in the sector.

item.title: ITC Hotels share listing price can go up to Rs 300 after demerger. What brokerages say - The Economic Times
item.description:
ITC Hotels Share Listing Price Projections Post-Demerger

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

Following the demerger of ITC Ltd, ITC Hotels shares are expected to be listed at a price range of Rs 200-300 per share according to brokerage firm Nomura. The listing will occur before mid-February 2025.

  • The demerger became effective on January 1, 2025.
  • Shareholders will receive one share of ITC Hotels for every ten shares held in ITC.
  • Nomura estimates the market cap of ITC Hotels will range from Rs 42,500-62,000 crore.
  • Centrum Broking anticipates a target price of Rs 583 for ITC shares.
  • The hotel business accounted for 4.3% of ITC’s overall sales in FY24.
  • ITC holds 140 properties, operating across six brands.
“Based on discussions with multiple market participants, we anticipate that the initial market price for ITC Hotels shares will range between Rs 150-175 per share,” Nuvama stated.

The demerger represents a strategic move for ITC, allowing it to focus more sharply on its hospitality business while also attracting new investors.

item.title: Kia Syros Bookings Start Tonight; Check Features, Specs, And More - NDTV
item.description:
Kia Syros Bookings Start Tonight; Check Features, Specs, And More

Publication Date: December 19, 2024
Source: NDTV

The Kia Syros is the latest SUV from Kia aimed at the Indian market, set for bookings starting tonight. It features a modern design, spacious interior, and various technological advancements.

  • Bookings for the Kia Syros begin tonight with a token amount of Rs 25,000.
  • The SUV has a contemporary exterior design with prominent LED headlights and a tall silhouette.
  • Available color options include Intense Red, Frost Blue, and several others.
  • The interior features a 30-inch panoramic display, wireless connectivity, and premium safety features.
  • It will be powered by a choice of 1.0-litre turbo petrol or 1.5-litre diesel engines.
"The SUV seeks to provide a spacious and comfortable experience, further enhanced by a panoramic sunroof."

The Kia Syros combines modern styling with advanced technology, aiming to attract consumers with its various features and competitive pricing.

item.title: Gold rate today nudges higher as investors await US data for US Fed rate cut cues. US inflation in focus | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Gold Rate Today: Investors Anticipate US Economic Data for Fed Rate Cut Insights

Date: Today
Source: Live Mint

The gold rate experienced a rise in early morning trading as investors await US economic data for insights on potential Federal Reserve rate cuts. The MCX gold rate opened at ₹77,000 per 10 gm, reflecting a notable increase in international gold prices.

Key Points:

  • The gold price reached an intraday high of ₹77,074 today.
  • Spot gold is trading at approximately $2,632 per troy ounce.
  • Market observers noted a buying interest influenced by weakness in the US dollar.
  • Analyst Kyle Rodda predicts a bullish trend in gold prices driven by geopolitical risks and expectations of rising government debt.
  • The markets currently see an 11.2% chance of a Fed rate cut in January 2025.
  • Investors are advised to consider economic data on inflation before making investment decisions.
“Chances of the US Fed rate cut are looking weak after the December 2024 US Fed meeting as the US inflation still exceeds 2 percent.” – Anuj Gupta, HDFC Securities

This rise in gold prices reflects market expectations of future rate cuts, but inflation concerns lead to caution among investors.

item.title: Manufacturing PMI slips to a 12-month low of 56.4 in Dec - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Manufacturing PMI slips to a 12-month low of 56.4 in December

Publication Date: January 02, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

India’s manufacturing activity closed the year at a 12-month low of 56.4 in December compared with 56.5 a month back, according to a private sector survey released on January 2.

  • The HSBC India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index declined from 57.5 to 56.5 in November.
  • This marks the second consecutive month of decline in manufacturing activity.
  • The index averaged over 57.5 in 2024, compared with 56.8 in the previous year.
“December marks the second consecutive month of decline in activity.”

This decline in the manufacturing PMI suggests potential challenges in the industrial sector moving forward.

item.title: New Honda SUV Spotted Testing! Launching Soon! - MotorOctane
item.description:
New Honda SUV Spotted Testing! Launching Soon!

Date: January 1, 2025
Source: MotorOctane

Honda has been seen testing its upcoming Elevate SUV, showcasing a new Black Edition that features a bold black exterior and interior design.

  • Honda's Elevate SUV has been successful, and the new Black Edition aims to enhance its appeal.
  • The Elevate Black Edition will have an all-black theme, including body work and alloys.
  • Expect cosmetic changes like a smoked effect on lights and a new badge.
  • Mechanically, it will retain the 1.5-litre NA petrol i-VTEC engine with 119 bhp.
  • Launching soon with a small price premium for the new edition.
“With this new look, the SUV will be able to fetch more attention in the country.”

In conclusion, the new Honda Elevate Black Edition is set to launch soon, promising to attract attention and potentially boost sales for Honda.

item.title: Stock Split, Bonus Issue: TWIN TREAT for shareholders; RECORD DATE in January - ET Now
item.description:
Stock Split, Bonus Issue: TWIN TREAT for shareholders; RECORD DATE in January

Updated: January 2, 2025, Source: ET NOW News

BN Rathi Securities has announced a stock split and bonus issue, rewarding shareholders with significant corporate actions.

  • Shareholders will receive one bonus share for every existing share held.
  • The stock will split in a 1:2 ratio, reducing face value from Rs 10 to Rs 5.
  • Record date for eligibility is set for January 24, 2025.
  • The stock has delivered an all-time return of 8,526% since May 2004.
  • Currently, shares are trading at Rs 249.95, down by 5.73%.
"Issue of Bonus Shares in the ratio of 1:1, i.e., 1 new fully paid-up equity share of Rs. 5/- each for every 1 existing fully paid-up equity share of Rs. 5/- each held by them," said the company.

This announcement reflects BN Rathi Securities' commitment to enhancing shareholder value and adapting to market dynamics.

item.title: Tanla Platforms shares rise 18% in just two sessions. More steam left? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Tanla Platforms Shares Surge 18% in Two Days: What's Next?

Date: January 2, 2024 Source: Live Mint

The share price of Tanla Platforms has risen significantly, gaining a total of 18% in just two trading sessions. This rise reflects strong trading activity and positive sentiment in the market.

  • Tanla Platforms shares rose 6% in early trading on January 2 after a 12% gain on January 1.
  • 4.63 lakh shares traded hands on the BSE, nearly four times the two-week average.
  • The stock opened at ₹750.45 and reached a high of ₹794.
  • Tanla's stock has experienced a 29% decline over the past year, yet still shows signs of potential recovery.
  • Analysts predict further upside for the stock, possibly reaching ₹875-₹890 in the near term.
“The rally is expected to continue further,” said Mahesh M Ojha, AVP — Research at Hensex Securities.

In conclusion, while Tanla Platforms has faced setbacks over the last year, recent trends indicate potential for a continued upward trajectory in share prices.

item.title: Anil Ambani-owned Reliance Power share price extends rally for third straight session | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Reliance Power Shares Continue Three-Day Rally with Debt Repayment

Date: January 1, 2024

Source: Live Mint

Reliance Power shares gained over 2% on Thursday, marking their third consecutive day of increases after the company repaid $150 million in debt.

The key highlights of the article are:

  • Reliance Power shares rose by 2.14% to ₹45.64 per share on the BSE.
  • The total increase in share price over three sessions is more than 9%.
  • Sasan Power repaid a $150 million loan to IIFCL, UK.
  • This repayment is expected to improve liquidity and credit ratings.
  • Sasan Power operates a 3960 MW Ultra Mega Power Plant in Madhya Pradesh, supplying electricity to 14 DISCOMs.
  • Reliance Power aims to transition towards renewable energy, having raised ₹1,525 crore through equity-linked warrants.
  • Reliance Power stock has shown significant growth over the past year and two years.
“The loan repayment further strengthens Reliance Power’s balance sheet as the company transitions its focus toward the renewable energy sector, which is poised to drive future growth.”

This development highlights Reliance Power's positive momentum and strategic focus on renewable energy moving forward.

item.title: Stocks to buy today for 2025: Citi upgrades Kotak Mahindra Bank to buy; Investec sees 26% upside in NTPC - The Economic Times
item.description:
Citi Upgrades Kotak Mahindra Bank; Investec Sees 26% Upside in NTPC for 2025

Publication Date: Not Provided Source: Economic Times

Leading brokerage firms have expressed optimism about Kotak Mahindra Bank and NTPC, highlighting their growth potential and strategic developments for 2025.

  • Citi has upgraded Kotak Mahindra Bank to a 'Buy' rating with a target price of Rs 2,070, indicating a potential upside of 15% from the current market price of Rs 1,788.
  • Investec maintains a 'Buy' rating on NTPC, with a revised target price of Rs 421, suggesting a potential upside of 26% from Rs 333.
  • Kotak Mahindra Bank's positive catalysts include strong loan growth and improving delinquency trends.
  • NTPC's stock correction is viewed as a buying opportunity, as the company focuses on renewable energy while maintaining stable coal-based capacity.

“The recent stock correction is seen as an opportunity for investors.”

In conclusion, brokerage upgrades reflect confidence in both Kotak Mahindra Bank and NTPC's strategies and market positions ahead of 2025.

item.title: December Auto Sales: Ashok Leyland shares rise as December 2024 sales beat estimates - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Ashok Leyland Shares Rise as December 2024 Sales Beat Estimates

Publication Date: January 2, 2025   Source: CNBC-TV18

Ashok Leyland reported impressive December sales figures, surpassing estimates and leading to an increase in share prices.

  • Total sales increased by 5% year-on-year.
  • Medium and Heavy Commercial Vehicles (M&HCVs) sales rose by 8%.
  • Total sales reached 16,957 units, exceeding the estimated 16,600 units.
  • M&HCV sales were reported at 11,474 units.
  • Light Commercial Vehicle (LCV) sales decreased by 1%.
  • Truck sales increased by 11%, while bus sales dropped by 3%.
“Inflation and higher commodity prices have necessitated this price increase. This move will help mitigate a part of the input cost impact.” - Ashok Leyland

The strong sales figures are a positive sign for Ashok Leyland as it prepares for a potential price increase across its commercial vehicle range in 2025.

item.title: Don't Miss Out! Air India Express New Year Sale. Flight ticket fares starting from just ₹1,448 | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Don’t Miss Out! Air India Express New Year Sale. Flight ticket fares starting from just ₹1,448

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: Live Mint

Air India Express has introduced a New Year Sale featuring flight fares as low as ₹1,448, available for bookings until January 5, for travel between January 8 and September 20, 2025.

  • Fares start at ₹1,448 under the Lite offer and ₹1,599 under the Value offer.
  • The Lite Offer is exclusive to logged-in loyalty members on the airline’s website or mobile app.
  • Included in the fare are base fare, taxes, and airport charges, but not convenience fees.
  • NeuCoins will be credited post-journey, based on passenger details matching government IDs.
  • Offers are subject to availability and cannot be canceled for a full refund.
  • Air India Express reserves the right to modify or terminate the offer at any time without notice.
“The Airline reserves the right to cancel, terminate, or suspend the Offer with or without any prior notice and reason,” Air India Express stated.

In conclusion, this promotional sale offers an opportunity for budget-conscious travelers to secure affordable flights in advance, though with certain terms and conditions.

item.title: Prajakta Koli opens up about consequences of extreme dieting, reveals her weight loss secrets: 'I tried...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Prajakta Koli Discusses Extreme Dieting and Her Weight Loss Journey

Date: Jan 02, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Prajakta Koli shares her experience with extreme dieting, admitting it led her to poor health. She emphasizes the importance of balance in her fitness journey.

  • Prajakta Koli reveals she tried a strict diet once but became clinically sick.
  • She has gained muscle while losing fat, leading to a healthier state.
  • Her weight loss secret is not dieting but exercising regularly.
  • She maintains her health through home-cooked meals and hydration.
  • Prajakta stresses mental health is tied to physical fitness.
“I cannot diet; food makes me too happy, I cannot leave it.”

In conclusion, Prajakta advocates for a balanced approach to fitness that prioritizes overall well-being over restrictive dieting.

item.title: Jefferies expects this stock to rise 55%; bets on power, defence names - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Jefferies predicts this stock to rise 55%; bets on power, defence names

Publication Date: Not specified Source: CNBCTV18

Global brokerage firm Jefferies highlights power and defense sectors as key areas for investment, with top stock picks being Siemens, HAL, Thermax, and L&T.

  • HAL has a 'Buy' rating with a projected price target of ₹5,500, indicating a 32% potential upside.
  • Thermax also holds a 'Buy' with a target of ₹6,100, implying a 55% potential rise.
  • L&T is rated 'Buy' with a target price of ₹4,600, showing a 25% upside potential.
  • Siemens is expected to benefit from improvements in its Power T&D division.
  • Jefferies' 2025 Industrials outlook reflects contrasting growth expectations amid political changes.
“BJP's victory in the Maharashtra elections has alleviated some investor concerns.”

The analysis indicates that Jefferies remains optimistic about the outlook for key players in the power and defense sectors despite recent uncertainties in the market.

item.title: Kunal Kamra asks Blinkit CEO to reveal wages of delivery partners, says quick commerce exploits gig workers - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kunal Kamra Criticizes Quick Commerce for Exploiting Gig Workers

Jan 02, 2025 - Hindustan Times

Comedian Kunal Kamra has criticized quick commerce platforms for exploiting gig workers, highlighting the dark side of convenience. These platforms, such as Blinkit, Swiggy Instamart, and Zepto, deliver groceries and other household goods to customers' doorsteps in minutes. However, Kamra points out the unfair wages and long working hours of gig workers in the industry.

Key Points:

  • Kamra criticized quick commerce platforms for low wages and long hours of gig workers.
  • He specifically targeted Blinkit CEO Albinder Dhindsa, asking him to reveal the average wages of delivery partners.
  • Kamra likened the CEOs of these companies to 'thugs' for exploiting gig workers without proper regulations.
  • Social media users supported Kamra's views, with many agreeing that these platforms exploit workers.
"They are thugs that are using data as oil without paying for the oil fields. Someday there will be regulation that humbles them..." - Kunal Kamra

Kamra's post has gathered over 1.9 lakh views with widespread support from other social media users.

item.title: Shooting itself in the foot - again: This trade barrier hurts India more - Business Standard
item.description:
India's Trade Policy: A Self-Inflicted Wound

Date: Recent | Source: Bloomberg Opinion

President-elect Donald Trump's renewed threats to impose tariffs on Indian imports highlight a deeper issue in India's trade policies, particularly the recent introduction of Quality Control Orders (QCOs) which are seen as restrictive and unpredictable for businesses.

  • Trump criticizes India for its high tariffs but overlooks the restrictive nature of QCOs.
  • Over 700 QCOs covering numerous imported goods have been issued, with plans for 2,500 total.
  • These orders complicate the import process, disproportionately affecting various sectors.
  • Domestic industries face challenges, including monopolistic pressures and inflated costs due to compliance with QCOs.
  • QCOs may lead to inflated prices and limited competition, adversely impacting labor-intensive sectors, while favoring larger, capital-intensive firms.
“Thousands of containers” of imported steel are stuck at Indian ports, affecting local manufacturing contracts.

The article underscores how India’s trade policies, meant to protect industries, may actually harm its own economic landscape.
